sentence.text: Here we characterize protein phosphorylation-dependent cancer cell migration and invasion as well as local invasion and metastasis of cancer xenografts.
protein phosphorylation depletion suppressed cancer invasion and induced an epithelial phenotype in poorly differentiated breast cancer cells.

In an unbiased BioID screen for protein phosphorylation interactors, we identified members of the Arp2/3 complex-mediated actin nucleation/3 complex and confirmed a physical and functional interaction between Plk4 and Arp2 in mediating Plk4-driven cancer cell movement.
Our results validate protein phosphorylation as a therapeutic target in cancer patients and reveal a new role for Plk4 in regulating Arp2/3-mediated actin cytoskeletal rearrangement.
